item.p: Write trigonometric identities to express the cosine and sine of an angle sum A + B \cos(A + B) \quad \text{and} \quad \sin(A+B) in terms of the four trigonmetric values \cos(A), \cos(B), \sin(A), and \sin(B).
Explain and demonstrate how to use the identities above and your knowledge of the unit circle to compute the values of \cos( {{AB}}^\circ ) and \sin( {{AB}}^\circ ).
Hence the desired values are: \cos( {{AB}}^\circ ) = {{cAB}} and \sin( {{AB}}^\circ ) = {{sAB}} .
